Package icyllis.arc3d.engine

Class GpuDevice

java.lang.Object
icyllis.arc3d.engine.GpuDevice
All Implemented Interfaces:
Engine
Direct Known Subclasses:
GLDevice, VulkanDevice
public abstract class GpuDevice extends Object implements Engine
Abstract base class that represents the logical device and graphics queue of the backend 3D API, holds a reference to DirectContext. It is responsible for creating/deleting 3D API objects, transferring data, submitting 3D API commands, etc. Most methods are only permitted on render thread (a.k.a. direct/RHI thread).

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect(boolean cleanup)
      Called by context when the underlying backend context is already or will be destroyed before DirectContext.

      If cleanup is true, free allocated resources (other than ResourceCache) before returning and ensure no backend 3D API calls will be made after this method returns. Otherwise, no cleanup should be attempted, immediately cease making backend API calls.

    • getStats

      public final GpuDevice.Stats getStats()

    • markContextDirty

      public final void markContextDirty(int state)
      The engine object normally assumes that no outsider is setting state within the underlying 3D API's context/device/whatever. This call informs the engine that the state was modified, and it shouldn't make assumptions about the state.

    • handleDirtyContext

      protected void handleDirtyContext(int state)

    • onResetContext

      protected void onResetContext(int resetBits)
      Called when the 3D context state is unknown. Subclass should emit any assumed 3D context state and dirty any state cache.

    • createTexture

      @Nullable @SharedPtr public final GpuTexture createTexture(int width, int height, BackendFormat format, int sampleCount, int surfaceFlags, String label)
      Creates a texture object and allocates its GPU memory. In other words, the image data is dirty and needs to be uploaded later. If mipmapped, also allocates (31 - CLZ(max(width,height))) mipmaps in addition to the base level. NPoT (non-power-of-two) dimensions are always supported. Compressed format are supported.
      Parameters:
      width - the width of the texture to be created
      height - the height of the texture to be created
      format - the backend format for the texture
      Returns:
      the texture object if successful, otherwise nullptr
      See Also:
      • ISurface.FLAG_BUDGETED
      • ISurface.FLAG_MIPMAPPED
      • ISurface.FLAG_RENDERABLE
      • ISurface.FLAG_PROTECTED

    • onCreateTexture

      @Nullable @SharedPtr protected abstract GpuTexture onCreateTexture(int width, int height, BackendFormat format, int mipLevelCount, int sampleCount, int surfaceFlags)
      Overridden by backend-specific derived class to create objects.

      Texture size and format support will have already been validated in base class before onCreateTexture is called.

    • wrapRenderableBackendTexture

      @Nullable @SharedPtr public GpuTexture wrapRenderableBackendTexture(BackendTexture texture, int sampleCount, boolean ownership)
      This makes the backend texture be renderable. If sampleCount is > 1 and the underlying API uses separate MSAA render buffers then a MSAA render buffer is created that resolves to the texture.

      Ownership specifies rules for external GPU resources imported into Engine. If false, Engine will assume the client will keep the resource alive and Engine will not free it. If true, Engine will assume ownership of the resource and free it.

      Parameters:
      texture - the backend texture must be single sample
      Returns:
      a non-cacheable render target, or null if failed

    • onWrapRenderableBackendTexture

      @Nullable @SharedPtr protected abstract GpuTexture onWrapRenderableBackendTexture(BackendTexture texture, int sampleCount, boolean ownership)

    • wrapBackendRenderTarget

      @Nullable @SharedPtr public GpuRenderTarget wrapBackendRenderTarget(BackendRenderTarget backendRenderTarget)

    • onWrapBackendRenderTarget

      @Nullable @SharedPtr public abstract GpuRenderTarget onWrapBackendRenderTarget(BackendRenderTarget backendRenderTarget)

    • writePixels

      public boolean writePixels(GpuTexture texture, int x, int y, int width, int height, int dstColorType, int srcColorType, int rowBytes, long pixels)
      Updates the pixels in a rectangle of a texture. No sRGB/linear conversions are performed. The write operation can fail because of the surface doesn't support writing (e.g. read only), the color type is not allowed for the format of the texture or if the rectangle written is not contained in the texture.
      Parameters:
      texture - the texture to write to
      dstColorType - the color type for this use of the texture
      srcColorType - the color type of the source buffer
      rowBytes - the row bytes, must be a multiple of srcColorType's bytes-per-pixel.
      pixels - the pointer to the texel data for base level image
      Returns:
      true if succeeded, false if not

    • onWritePixels

      protected abstract boolean onWritePixels(GpuTexture texture, int x, int y, int width, int height, int dstColorType, int srcColorType, int rowBytes, long pixels)

    • generateMipmaps

      public final boolean generateMipmaps(GpuTexture texture)
      Uses the base level of the texture to compute the contents of the other mipmap levels.
      Returns:
      success or not

    • copySurface

      public final boolean copySurface(IGpuSurface src, int srcX, int srcY, IGpuSurface dst, int dstX, int dstY, int width, int height)
      Special case of copySurface(icyllis.arc3d.engine.IGpuSurface, int, int, icyllis.arc3d.engine.IGpuSurface, int, int, int, int) that has same dimensions.

    • copySurface

      public final boolean copySurface(IGpuSurface src, int srcL, int srcT, int srcR, int srcB, IGpuSurface dst, int dstL, int dstT, int dstR, int dstB, int filter)
      Perform a surface-to-surface copy, with the specified regions.

      If their dimensions are same and formats are compatible, then this method will attempt to perform copy. Otherwise, this method will attempt to perform blit, which may include resampling and format conversion. filter can be one of SamplerState.FILTER_NEAREST and SamplerState.FILTER_LINEAR.

      Only mipmap level 0 of 2D images will be copied, without any multisampled buffer and depth/stencil buffer.

      Returns:
      success or not

    • onCopySurface

      protected abstract boolean onCopySurface(IGpuSurface src, int srcL, int srcT, int srcR, int srcB, IGpuSurface dst, int dstL, int dstT, int dstR, int dstB, int filter)

    • getOpsRenderPass

      @Nullable public final OpsRenderPass getOpsRenderPass(SurfaceView writeView, Rect2i contentBounds, byte colorOps, byte stencilOps, float[] clearColor, Set<TextureProxy> sampledTextures, int pipelineFlags)
      Returns a OpsRenderPass which OpsTasks record draw commands to.
      Parameters:
      writeView - the render target to be rendered to
      contentBounds - the clipped content bounds of the render pass
      colorOps - the color load/store ops
      stencilOps - the stencil load/store ops
      clearColor - the color used to clear the color buffer
      sampledTextures - list of all textures to be sampled in the render pass (no refs)
      pipelineFlags - combination of flags of all pipelines to be used in the render pass
      Returns:
      a render pass used to record draw commands, or null if failed

    • onGetOpsRenderPass

      protected abstract OpsRenderPass onGetOpsRenderPass(SurfaceView writeView, Rect2i contentBounds, byte colorOps, byte stencilOps, float[] clearColor, Set<TextureProxy> sampledTextures, int pipelineFlags)

    • resolveRenderTarget

      public void resolveRenderTarget(GpuRenderTarget renderTarget, int resolveLeft, int resolveTop, int resolveRight, int resolveBottom)
      Resolves MSAA. The resolve rectangle must already be in the native destination space.

    • onResolveRenderTarget

      protected abstract void onResolveRenderTarget(GpuRenderTarget renderTarget, int resolveLeft, int resolveTop, int resolveRight, int resolveBottom)

    • insertFence

      public abstract long insertFence()
      Creates a new fence and inserts it into the graphics queue. Calls deleteFence(long) if the fence is no longer used.
      Returns:
      the handle to the fence, or null if failed

    • checkFence

      public abstract boolean checkFence(long fence)
      Checks a fence on client side to see if signalled. This method returns immediately.
      Parameters:
      fence - the handle to the fence
      Returns:
      true if signalled, false otherwise

    • deleteFence

      public abstract void deleteFence(long fence)
      Deletes an existing fence that previously returned by insertFence().
      Parameters:
      fence - the handle to the fence, cannot be null
